content: University students in South Africa say they've created new environmentally friendly bricks using human urine

The students from Cape Town combined urine collected for men's toilets with sand and bacteria in the process that allows the bricks to solidify naturally at room temperature place an enzyme and the mixture breaks down the urine to produce calcium carbonate a key component of limestone which finds the other materials together
